<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>New View Toggle Preview</title>
    <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Space+Grotesk:wght@700&display=swap" rel="stylesheet">
    <style>
        body {
            background: #1a1a1a;
            margin: 0;
            padding: 0;
            width: 1920px;
            font-family: 'Space Grotesk', sans-serif;
            color: white;
        }
        
        /* Container to show positioning */
        .preview-container {
            position: relative;
            width: 1920px;
            height: 300px;
            background: #0a0a0a;
        }
        
        /* Mock docket header for reference */
        .mock-docket {
            position: absolute;
            top: 9px;
            left: 11px;
            width: 1898px;
            height: 48px;
            background-color: #253541;
            border: 3px solid #9ba1a6;
            border-radius: 36px;
            display: flex;
            align-items: center;
            justify-content: center;
            font-size: 14px;
            color: #9ba1a6;
        }
        
        /* New View Toggle Container */
        .view-toggle-new {
            position: absolute;
            top: 76px;
            left: 70px;
            width: 270px;
            height: 40px;
            background-color: #253541;
            border: 3px solid #9ba1a6;
            border-radius: 36px;
            box-sizing: border-box;
            overflow: visible;
        }
        
        /* View labels */
        .view-labels {
            display: flex;
            position: absolute;
            width: 100%;
            height: 100%;
            align-items: center;
            z-index: 2;
        }
        
        .view-label {
            font-family: 'Space Grotesk', sans-serif;
            font-weight: 700;
            font-size: 16px;
            text-transform: lowercase;
            cursor: pointer;
            transition: color 0.3s ease;
            user-select: none;
        }
        
        .view-label.viotagger {
            position: absolute;
            left: 8px; /* Moved left by 2px (was 10px) */
            width: 75px;
            text-align: center;
            color: #9ba1a6;
        }
        
        .view-label.report {
            position: absolute;
            left: 97px;
            width: 75px;
            text-align: center;
            color: #9ba1a6;
        }
        
        .view-label.evidence {
            position: absolute;
            left: 189px; /* Moved right by 4px total (was 185px) */
            width: 75px;
            text-align: center;
            color: #9ba1a6;
        }
        
        /* Active state labels */
        .view-label.active {
            color: #ffffff;
        }
        
        /* Individual toggle buttons (orange highlight) */
        .toggle-indicator {
            position: absolute;
            top: -3px; /* Move up 3px */
            width: 90px;
            height: 40px;
            background-color: #f26419;
            border: 3px solid #f8b98c;
            border-radius: 36px;
            box-sizing: border-box;
            transition: left 0.3s ease;
            z-index: 1;
        }
        
        /* Toggle indicator positions */
        .toggle-indicator.viotagger {
            left: 0;
        }
        
        .toggle-indicator.report {
            left: 90px;
        }
        
        .toggle-indicator.evidence {
            left: 180px;
        }
        
        /* Comparison section */
        .comparison {
            margin-top: 50px;
            padding: 20px;
        }
        
        .old-toggle {
            display: inline-flex;
            gap: 8px;
            background-color: #F3F4F6;
            padding: 4px;
            border-radius: 24px;
            margin-bottom: 20px;
        }
        
        .old-btn {
            padding: 8px 16px;
            border-radius: 24px;
            font-size: 18px;
            font-weight: 500;
            color: #64748B;
            background: none;
            border: none;
            cursor: pointer;
            display: flex;
            align-items: center;
            gap: 8px;
        }
        
        .old-btn.active {
            background-color: #0066FF;
            color: white;
        }
        
        /* Demo controls */
        .demo-controls {
            position: fixed;
            bottom: 20px;
            left: 20px;
            background: #333;
            padding: 20px;
            border-radius: 8px;
        }
        
        .demo-controls button {
            background: #f26419;
            border: none;
            color: white;
            padding: 10px 20px;
            margin: 5px;
            border-radius: 4px;
            cursor: pointer;
            font-family: 'Space Grotesk', sans-serif;
            font-weight: 700;
        }
        
        .demo-controls button:hover {
            background: #d94a0c;
        }
        
        /* Specs display */
        .specs {
            position: absolute;
            right: 20px;
            top: 20px;

            padding: 20px;
            border-radius: 8px;

Based on my search through the codebase, I've found the following canvas-related styling information:

## Canvas Styling Summary

### 1. **Report Canvas** (`#Image_Canvas_Container`)
Located in `/home/avid_arrajeedavey/style/canvas-view.css`:
- Position: `absolute`, `top: 140px`, `left: 15px`
- Dimensions: `810px × 920px`
- Styling: White background, 24px border radius, subtle shadow
- Purpose: Main container for credit report PNG images

### 2. **Evidence Canvas** (`#Evidence_Canvas_Container`)
Located in `/home/avid_arrajeedavey/style/evidence-canvas.css` and `/home/avid_arrajeedavey/style/evidence-canvas-content.css`:
- Position: `absolute`, `top: 19px`, `left: 1100px`
- Dimensions: `795px × 1042px`
- Styling: White background, 24px border radius, shadow
- Purpose: Right-side panel that displays evidence documents
- **This appears to be the "sidebar" mentioned** - it's positioned at 1100px from the left

### 3. **VioTagger Canvas**
The VioTagger canvas doesn't appear to have dedicated CSS styling yet. Based on the view toggle implementation files, VioTagger is one of three views (viotagger, report, evidence) but its canvas container styling is not defined in the current codebase.

### Key Alignment Information:
- The report canvas starts at `left: 15px`
- The evidence canvas (sidebar) starts at `left: 1100px`
- There's a gap of approximately 275px between the report canvas (ends at 825px) and evidence canvas (starts at 1100px)

### Canvas Heading Positioning:
- Canvas heading: `top: 164px`, `left: 15px`, `width: 810px`
- Evidence heading: `left: 1227.5px`, `top: 12px`, `width: 533px`

The evidence canvas at 1100px appears to be what's referred to as the "sidebar" since it's positioned to the right of the main report canvas and contains supplementary evidence documentation.

content.thinking: Let me check the evidence heading CSS styling.

Now I understand the issue better. Looking at the CSS:

1. **Report Canvas** (main canvas): 
   - Position: top: 140px, left: 15px
   - Width: 810px, Height: 920px

2. **Evidence Canvas**:
   - Position: top: 19px, left: 1100px  
   - Width: 795px, Height: 1042px

3. **Canvas Heading** (for report canvas):
   - Position: top: 140px, left: 15px
   - Width: 810px, Height: 60px

4. **Evidence Heading**:
   - Position: top: 12px, left: 1227.5px
   - Width: 533px, Height: 32px

The issue is that the evidence heading is positioned at left: 1227.5px while the evidence canvas is at left: 1100px. This creates a misalignment. 

The evidence heading should be:
- Aligned with the evidence canvas x position (1100px)
- At the same y position as the report canvas heading (140px)

Let me propose three solutions:

### Solution 1: Align Evidence Heading with Evidence Canvas Position
Adjust the Evidence_Heading_Container position to match the evidence canvas x-coordinate and align it vertically with the report canvas heading.

### Solution 2: Create a Unified Heading System
Create a single heading container that switches content based on the active view mode (report vs evidence).

### Solution 3: Adjust Evidence Canvas Position to Match Current Heading
Move the evidence canvas to align with the current evidence heading position.

The best solution is **Solution 1** because:
- It maintains the existing structure
- Requires minimal code changes
- Preserves the visual hierarchy
- Aligns with the stated requirement that evidence canvas should align exactly with report canvas

Let me implement this solution.

content.text:
Based on my analysis, I've identified the alignment issue. Here are three solutions:

## Three Solutions:

### 1. **Align Evidence Heading with Evidence Canvas** (Recommended)
   - Adjust Evidence_Heading_Container to match evidence canvas position
   - Change left: 1227.5px → left: 1100px
   - Change top: 12px → top: 140px (to match report canvas heading)

### 2. **Create Unified Heading System**
   - Use single heading container that switches content
   - Maintains consistent positioning across views
   - More complex but cleaner architecture

### 3. **Move Evidence Canvas to Match Heading**
   - Adjust evidence canvas left position from 1100px to match heading
   - Less ideal as it changes the overall layout

## Best Solution: Option 1

I'll implement the alignment fix to position the evidence heading correctly:

content.text:
## Fixed!

I've successfully aligned the evidence canvas with the report and viotagger canvases by:

1. **Added Evidence Navigation Bar**: Created a new navigation bar structure inside the evidence canvas container that matches the report canvas design

2. **Applied Consistent Styling**: Extended the CSS to include `.evidence-nav-bar` with the same styling as `.report-nav-bar`:
   - Same position (left: 9px, top: 15px)
   - Same dimensions (792px × 40px)
   - Same styling (dark background, border, rounded corners)

3. **Created Evidence-Specific Segments**: Added three navigation segments for evidence:
   - Category selector (left: 20px)
   - Document selector (left: 280px)  
   - Page selector (left: 640px)

4. **Positioned Navigation Arrows**: Added proper arrow positioning for each segment

The evidence canvas now has the same visual structure as the report canvas, with a navigation bar at the top that provides consistent alignment across all three views (viotagger, report, and evidence).
